intro: Jasminoides rhombifolium, commonly known as the rhombic leaf jasmine, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its rhombic-shaped leaves and fragrant white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant belongs to the Oleaceae family, which includes other well-known jasmine species. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for horticultural cultivation in warm climates.
